medical_history.chief_complaint: RUQ/epigastric pain with associated nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports that the pain started last week with sudden sharp pain in the RUQ/epigastric region, associated with nausea and vomiting. The pain has never completely resolved since her previous visit. Last night, at approximately 3 AM, she awoke with sudden onset of pain that progressed throughout the night, accompanied by nonbilious nonbloody vomiting. The sharp, intermittent pain radiated to her back and was associated with PO intake, not linked to any activity.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Right-sided living-donor kidney transplant from her mother due to urethral valve reflux. 2. Chronic hypertension, managed with Procardia XL prior to pregnancy and labetalol during pregnancy. 3. Obesity. 4. Itching on and off with no clear etiology. 5. Anemia.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for type 2 diabetes on her mother's side and developmental delay/questionable mental retardation in two paternal great uncles.
